title: Bug 42225 - Issue with Ctrl+Backspace Key Assignment
description: This bug report addresses difficulties in assigning a command to the Ctrl+Backspace key combination.
OB: The observed behavior is that the keybinding manager mistakenly interprets Ctrl+Backspace as Ctrl+Del, leading to the deletion of the next word. When attempting to reassign the key via the key preference page, it incorrectly displays Ctrl+Del when Ctrl+Backspace is pressed. This behavior occurs when using a Swiss German keyboard with Swiss German Locale.
EB: The expected behavior is that users should be able to assign a command to Ctrl+Backspace without any misinterpretation by the keybinding manager. It should correctly identify Ctrl+Backspace as the desired key combination. Users with a Swiss German keyboard and Swiss German Locale should not encounter issues when customizing key assignments.
SR:
To replicate the issue:
1. Utilize a Swiss German keyboard with Swiss German locale settings.
2. Open the keybinding manager or key preference page in the software.
3. Attempt to assign a command to Ctrl+Backspace.

Desired Outcome: The keybinding manager should accurately recognize and accept Ctrl+Backspace as the selected key combination.

Actual Outcome: The keybinding manager misinterprets Ctrl+Backspace as Ctrl+Del, resulting in the deletion of the next word, and incorrectly displays Ctrl+Del when trying to reassign the key.
